# Welcome to the Brain Development and Education Lab! {#sec-welcome}

## About the lab {#sec-about-the-lab}

Welcome to the lab of Dr. Jason Yeatman, Associate Professor in the Graduate School of Education and Department of Psychology at Stanford University and the Division of Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics at Stanford University School of Medicine.
Our mission is to understand the interplay between brain maturation and cognitive development, with a particular focus on the mechanisms underlying learning to read and how these differ in children with dyslexia.
The lab is deeply interdisciplinary, drawing on neuroscience, psychology, education, pediatrics, and engineering to answer both basic scientific and applied questions.
A cornerstone of our work is the Rapid Online Assessment of Reading (ROAR)â€”an online platform for assessing foundational reading skills that consists of a suite of measures validated K-12.
Each ROAR measure is delivered through a web browser, is fully automated, and does not require a test administrator, yet rapidly provides precise indices of reading ability with greater precision than many standardized, individually-administered assessments.
This research-practice partnership model bridges research and practice, enabling large-scale data collection that helps us develop personalized intervention programs tailored to each child's unique pattern of brain maturation while advancing our understanding of how reading instruction shapes brain development and plasticity in children, including those with dyslexia.

## About this lab manual {#sec-about-lab-manual}

This lab manual covers our communication strategy, code of conduct, and best practices for reproducibility of computational workflows.
It is a living document that is updated regularly.
